data.title: Good food, good price
data.text: Love the food. Dont expect good service, must good food for the price.  They don't except debt\credit cards, its an oriental thing.  But good food and plenty of it.

data.title: weekly lunch
data.text: A friend and I get chiyo's about once a  week for lunch.  Great food. Great price. and it's enough food for us to get a few meals out of

data.title: A favorite place to dine.
data.text: It has been a favorite of mine for years. I have never had a bad dish or unpleasant experience. I have many favorites there but the weekly specials are always good.

data.title: Lots of good food for the $!
data.text: This is a little hole in the wall that has consistently good food and service with good value.  My husband and I can share a lunch, get two waters and with tip pay about $9!  Lots of food for the money and clean.

data.title: Great food, big portions, inexpensive prices
data.text:
This has been one of my favorite go-to places in Amarillo. The food is prepared fresh, is piping hot and tastes great. The dinner portions are usually big enough for two meals. And the prices are inexpensive. 
I always get the food to go. I call ahead, and I hardly spend any time waiting.
The dining atmosphere is OK. But the food is awesome and more than makes up for the dining atmosphere.
It also has a drive-thru window.
Workers always have been polite and courteous.

data.title: Average Oriental Food
data.text: This place is a Thai-Chinese restaurant with a small dine-in area and a drive-thru.  It seemed clean and the staff was friendly.  I ordered Pad Thai with veggies.  It was either that or veggie fried rice.  Perhaps other menu items could have been made vegetarian, but it was a typical, non-veg friendly menu.  They do not serve tofu or any other vegetarian alternative.  That said, I ordered Pad Thai, which is not a favorite dish of mine anyway, but didn't have much choice.  My husband ordered jerky and rice.  It was about 25$.  It seemed a bit high in price...until I opened the package at home.  There was a ton of meat and rice, which was a little over 10$.  My husband gave it 3 out of 5 stars as far as flavor.  He said it "tasted less gamey" than Thai House (His usual spot for jerky and rice).  I can't decide if that was a compliment or not?!  My dish was...meh.  It seemed super-saucy compared to other pad thai's-almost re-minded me more of chow mein, but sweeter.  I squeezed extra lime on it to counter-act the sweetness.  The veggies seemed fresh, and it was MOLTEN LAVA-HOT.  THE FOOD WAS SO HOT, IN FACT, THAT IT BURNED HOLES INTO THE STYROFAOM PACKAGING!  We placed the order, and not even 5 minutes later we had our package and were out the door.  The swiftness of filling our order made us question just how fresh our food was...WILL I RETURN?  Probably not.  "Bagan" is another 2 minutes down the road and seems much more authentic and fresh and has tofu!  :)

data.title: Good food Good Price!!
data.text: Good food Good price and Good service!! Ckn fried rice, Chow Mein, and Pai Thai mmmmmmm!!
